name: Actpriority
title: actpriority
description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying the priority for the shipment.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the SHP segment.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0906 (ActPriority)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

property.description: Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

concept.display: ASAP - As soon as possible, next highest priority after stat
concept.definition: ASAP - As soon as possible, next highest priority after stat

concept.display: Callback results - filler should contact the placer as soon as results are available, even for preliminary results
concept.definition: Callback results - filler should contact the placer as soon as results are available, even for preliminary results

concept.display: Callback for scheduling - Filler should contact the placer (or target) to schedule the service.
concept.definition: Callback for scheduling - Filler should contact the placer (or target) to schedule the service.

concept.display: Callback placer for scheduling - filler should contact the placer to schedule the service
concept.definition: Callback placer for scheduling - filler should contact the placer to schedule the service

concept.display: Contact recipient for scheduling - Filler should contact the service recipient (target) to schedule the service
concept.definition: Contact recipient for scheduling - Filler should contact the service recipient (target) to schedule the service

concept.display: Elective - Beneficial to the patient but not essential for survival.
concept.definition: Elective - Beneficial to the patient but not essential for survival.

concept.display: Emergency - An unforeseen combination of circumstances or the resulting state that calls for immediate action
concept.definition: Emergency - An unforeseen combination of circumstances or the resulting state that calls for immediate action

concept.display: Preop - Used to indicate that a service is to be performed prior to a scheduled surgery.  When ordering a service and using the pre-op priority, a check is done to see the amount of time that must be allowed for performance of the service.  When the order
concept.definition: Preop â€“ Used to indicate that a service is to be performed prior to a scheduled surgery.  When ordering a service and using the pre-op priority, a check is done to see the amount of time that must be allowed for performance of the service.  When the order is placed, a message can be generated indicating the time needed for the service so that it is not ordered in conflict with a scheduled operation.

concept.display: As needed - An "as needed" order should be accompanied by a description of what constitutes a need.  This description is represented by an observation service predicate as a precondition.
concept.definition: As needed - An "as needed" order should be accompanied by a description of what constitutes a need.  This description is represented by an observation service predicate as a precondition.

concept.display: Routine - Routine service, do at usual work hours
concept.definition: Routine - Routine service, do at usual work hours

concept.display: Rush reporting - A report should be prepared and sent as quickly as possible
concept.definition: Rush reporting - A report should be prepared and sent as quickly as possible

concept.display: Timing critical - It is critical to come as close as possible to the requested time (e.g. for a through antimicrobial level).
concept.definition: Timing critical - It is critical to come as close as possible to the requested time (e.g. for a through antimicrobial level).

concept.display: Use as directed - Drug is to be used as directed by the prescriber.
concept.definition: Use as directed - Drug is to be used as directed by the prescriber.
